article.title: The Mass and Momentum Outflow Rates of Photoionized Galactic Outflows

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 1 show about the relationship between maximum mass-loading factor (M/SFRcos) and stellar mass (M*)?
choices: There is a positive correlation between maximum mass-loading factor and stellar mass.
There is no correlation between maximum mass-loading factor and stellar mass.
There is a negative correlation between maximum mass-loading factor and stellar mass.
High-mass mergers have significantly higher mass-loading factors than other galaxies.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2 depicts the relationship between outflow momentum efficiency (po/pSFR) and stellar mass (M*). What trend does the figure illustrate?
choices: Outflow momentum efficiency increases with increasing stellar mass.
Outflow momentum efficiency is independent of stellar mass.
Outflow momentum efficiency decreases with increasing stellar mass.
High-mass mergers have significantly lower outflow momentum efficiencies.

multiple_choice_question.text: What relationship does Figure 3 reveal between outflow energy efficiency (Eo/ESFR) and stellar mass (M*)?
choices: A strong positive correlation.
No significant correlation, but a trend of higher mass galaxies having lower energy efficiency.
A strong negative correlation.
High-mass mergers have significantly higher energy efficiencies.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure compares observed mass-loading factors with simulations. What is the key takeaway?
choices: The FIRE simulation accurately predicts the observed mass-loading factors.
The Somerville et al. (2008) relation perfectly matches the observed data.
The observed photoionized outflows have mass-loading factors roughly five times weaker than simulated relations.
Observed and simulated mass-loading factors are identical.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does this simplified model demonstrate about outflow momentum?
choices: Outflow momentum is solely determined by star formation momentum.
Gravity plays no role in shaping outflow momentum.
The model considers the impact of both star formation momentum accelerating the outflow and gravity counteracting this acceleration.
This model perfectly replicates all observed outflow momenta without limitations.
